abstract: Thirty seconds of advertising time on the Academy Awards will cost an estimated $1.6 million. To ensure that no dollar goes to waste, marketers like J.C. Penney, Unilever and MasterCard are “planning to run spots previously unseen by consumers,” Stuart Elliott reports in today’s New York Times.
lead_paragraph: Thirty seconds of advertising time on the Academy Awards will cost an estimated $1.6 million. To ensure that no dollar goes to waste, marketers like J.C. Penney, Unilever and MasterCard are “planning to run spots previously unseen by consumers,” Stuart Elliott reports in today’s New York Times.

headline.main: 30 Seconds Cost a Lot, but the Memories May Be Priceless
